api_token.description: The API authorization token. It can also be sourced from the OPSLEVEL_API_TOKEN environment variable.

api_url.description: The url of the OpsLevel API to. It can also be sourced from the OPSLEVEL_API_URL environment variable.

category.description: The id of the category the check belongs to.

enabled.description: Whether the check is enabled or not.

filter.description: The id of the filter of the check.

integration.description: The integration id this check will use.

level.description: The id of the level the check belongs to.

message.description: The check result message template. It is compiled with Liquid and formatted in Markdown.

name.description: The display name of the check.

owner.description: The id of the team that owns the check.

service_selector.description: A jq expression that will be ran against your payload. This will parse out the service identifier.

success_condition.description: A jq expression that will be ran against your payload. A truthy value will result in the check passing.

category.description: The id of the category the check belongs to.

enabled.description: Whether the check is enabled or not.

filter.description: The id of the filter of the check.

level.description: The id of the level the check belongs to.

name.description: The display name of the check.

owner.description: The id of the team that owns the check.

update_requires_comment.description: Whether the check requires a comment or not.

starting_data.description: The date that the check will start to evaluate.

time_scale.description: The time scale type for the frequency.

value.description: The value to be used together with the frequency scale.

block.description: Defines the minimum frequency of the updates.

category.description: The id of the category the check belongs to.

directory_search.description: Whether the check looks for the existence of a directory instead of a file.

enabled.description: Whether the check is enabled or not.

filepaths.description: Restrict the search to certain file paths.

value.description: The condition value used by the predicate.

file_extensions.description: Restrict the search to files of given extensions. Extensions should contain only letters and numbers. For example: ["py", "rb"].

connective.description: The logical operator to be used in conjunction with predicates.

key.description: The condition key used by the predicate.

key_data.description: Additional data used by the predicate. This field is used by predicates with key = 'tags' to specify the tag key. For example, to create a predicate for services containing the tag 'db:mysql', set keyData = 'db' and value = 'mysql'.

type.description: The condition type used by the predicate.

value.description: The condition value used by the predicate.

block.description: The list of predicates used to select which services apply to the filter.

name.description: The display name of the category.

index.description: An integer allowing this level to be inserted between others. Must be unique per Rubric.

owner_alias.description: The team that owns the service.

tier_alias.description: The software tier that the service belongs to.
